title: Hope you like ads.
text:
Very poor overall. Bare-bones design, no sound whatsoever, stale and monotonous ‚Äúgameplay‚Äù, tedious and uninspired progression, and absolutely flooded with ads. 

Not worth playing for more than a half hour or so, definitely not worth spending money on.

title: Really awesome potential, some issues
text: Music. Please add SOME music. Really annoying sitting in silence. I don‚Äôt care if it‚Äôs some royalty free on loop annoying stuff. Also, sometimes the pickaxe can‚Äôt reach the stone and I can‚Äôt get resources. Finally, when I start mining, when I press the upgrades button it doesn‚Äôt do anything. I feel like this could be an awesome game if you‚Äôd fix these simple issues. Bonne journee!

title: The numbers are incorrect...
text: So I‚Äôve been playing this game for a little while and I‚Äôve gotten a sword that is supposed to give me 1.2k but my money is only going up by hundreds not thousands and they are wanting us to pay 250k for capacity upgrades it‚Äôs just ridiculous and annoying.

title: Feels incomplete
text:
This game has a lot of potential for additional content, or even alternative content.  There‚Äôs a level system, but as it is, it‚Äôs only a number, nothing is attached to it, and it‚Äôs basically just how many swords you‚Äôve crafted.  I think you should link the sword crafting pieces to the level value, like when you reach level 50, you unlock the first new hilt you can buy, and at 100, a new blade, and so on.  When I select a sword from the rack, I see a button that says ‚ÄúNo Mission‚Äù, and that opens up an entire feature that would make this game stand apart from others like it.

So, in summary, this game feels intentionally incomplete, and with the insane amount of ads, this may just be some quick money for the studio.  If that‚Äôs the case, I urge you to come back to this and overhaul the game.  There is a lot of potential here.

title: Where‚Äôs the sound?

title: Suggestions for the game
text:
I really think this is a fun game snd great way to kill time if you are bored. Still, even with the addition of scrapping useless swords, I still feel like you get money too slow when you get farther into the game. I have a few suggestions that could make the game much more fun and addictive.
1.) Quests (Examples - forge __ rare swords, mine __ diamonds, forge __ swords)
2.) Online mini games (Example - whoever forges the bests swordfish I gets 1st-1st place gets the most money, and 3rd gets the least.
3.) New upgrade for mining (This upgrade will allow you to get better ores out of rocks so you are not constantly getting bad ores) 
4.) Bank (Useless swords can go in here with a max capacity of about 3-5, and after a while they can sell for more when they are scrapped)

I think these are some great suggestions, and I‚Äôm sure many people would agree! This game could be really fun if these are added, and I hope they will be soon!

title: Unfinished and glitchy
text:
So yeah. First thing I noticed. When entering the game after having it closed for a while... you get the ‚Äúyou earned this much‚Äù with the options ‚Äúcollect‚Äù and ‚Äúwatch video to multiply and collect‚Äù... 90% of the time, the video multiplication button doesn‚Äôt work.

Now... I have millions in the bank... and I can‚Äôt upgrade anything. I click the buttons to upgrade and it won‚Äôt do anything. I‚Äôve more than enough cash... but the buttons aren‚Äôt working.

Also... my soldiers and the sort that come in to buy my swords... have just stopped spawning completely.

title: Time
text: There needs to be more content, I finished every upgrade in ONE day. Let‚Äôs see where we can start, more upgrades like ore guarantee percentage or new stations that could dissemble items into ores, this game also needs a crafting station like, take out that system where you mine an item and it drops down to the crucible and replace it with an inventory, a crafting table and, perhaps a legit selling system that doesn‚Äôt require people flying in t-posing. Last and most biggest suggestion let the player make a shop or build one themselves using materials and time.

title: Great concept, needs polish
text: The game‚Äôs clearly still in early development, but the idea is solid. Could definitely become a great game, and I look forward to seeing how it develops.

title: Potential
text: This game has plenty of potential but the developer may not want to invest the time. The people who come in with missions are t-posing which means that their individual character dynamics are still in development. Add some new ores and some other features such as, special commissions that pay more, dynamic story driven missions, and achievements. Once again this game has cool potential. The developers need to deliver.

title: Got time to kill? Find something else to play.
text:
I only review games that I feel need extra explaining.

This ‚Äúgame‚Äù just repeats itself over and over again. It‚Äôs not very forgiving when it comes to progression so you literally make the same sword over and over again. Not the most fun, as I think I only enjoyed myself like the first 5 minutes. If you are into grindy games, then you might like it.

ON TOP OF THAT... they play an advertisement after every single sword you make so you‚Äôll be watching a lot of the same video OVER AND OVER AGAIN. Would be heavily improved if they make it so that ads only play every other sword or every third sword. There is an option to pay $5 to remove ads but this game doesn‚Äôt offer enough for me to want to pay that much. Perhaps if they made more items other than just swords you could make or lowered the cost to buy new sword parts.

title: It‚Äôs not to bad of a game
text: The game is pretty good. I done a 4 star review simply due to the fact there isn‚Äôt a ‚Äúore key‚Äù it would be nice to have a key so you know what ore you should be looking for. At this time you must guess if the ore is either silver or diamond or tin and so on. But as the title say, this isn‚Äôt a bad game and the ads DON‚ÄôT seem to be to overwhelming where I can‚Äôt stand the game.

title: The ads make the game unplayable.
text: This would be a reasonably good, relaxing game, were it not for the ads. Often, an unmovable, undeletable ad will appear on the left side of the screen, covering visual elements necessary to play the game. This design flaw obstructs gameplay and is only accented by the need to watch video ads in order to progress in the game. Upgrades are locked behind advertisements, which becomes a major pain when you have several stats to upgrade.

title: Fun game but to many adds
